meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I warked on my homework until it was done.
meanings.sent2: She warked hard to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The little ant warked tirelessly to gather food for the winter.
meanings.sent4: After hours of warking in the garden, the flowers bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic warked diligently to repair the broken engine.

meanings.definition: Warked (adjective): having worked or been worked on
meanings.sent1: The warked car looked shiny and new after the repair.
meanings.sent2: The warked puzzle was finally completed after hours of effort.
meanings.sent3: The warked bookshelf held many cherished books in its sturdy shelves.
meanings.sent4: Her warked hands showed the signs of a day spent gardening.
meanings.sent5: The warked canvas displayed a beautiful painting of the countryside.

meanings.definition: Warked (noun): a unit of work or effort
meanings.sent1: He measured his progress in the garden by the number of warks completed.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated each warked they achieved towards their goal.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed her jar filled with colorful warks.
meanings.sent4: Each warked brought them closer to completing the challenging project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher rewarded the students for their hard work with a warked chart.
